thread.title: Podcast: Breaking down K-State football's collapse against TCU
thread.title_full: Podcast: Breaking down K-State football's collapse against TCU

author: The Capital-Journal
title: Podcast: Breaking down K-State football's collapse against TCU
text:
By The Capital-Journal 
MANHATTAN — There has been a lot of second-guessing of the K-State football team this week in the wake of the Wildcats blowing an 18-point lead in a 52-45 defeat to No. 2 TCU last Saturday. 
In fact, some of the second-guessing has come from the man many are questioning in the first place. 
“At the end of the day it was just a bad choice on my part,” K-State coach Bill Snyder said Monday on the Big 12 teleconference, on his decision to kick a late fourth-quarter field goal instead of trying to convert a fourth-and-1. “Hindsight tells me if I had to do it again, I’d do it differently. I’m totally responsible for that.” 
Is Snyder really to blame for the Wildcats' collapse, or were there other mistakes made leading up to the fourth-and-1 play call? The Topeka Capital-Journal's Ken Corbitt, Kevin Haskin and Tim Bisel debate this on the latest edition of the KSU CatZone Podcast. Also discussed: whether injuries affected K-State's second-half strategy, the decision to abandon the running game in the second half, and the Wildcats' next game against reeling Oklahoma.
